properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 12:18PM CST until January 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
...Winter Weather Advisory...

.All winter weather headlines have been cancelled across southeast
Kansas and for Missouri counties west of the Highway 65 corridor.
Both air and surface temperatures have risen above freezing early
this afternoon, and precipitation has transitioned to plain rain with
no additional road impacts anticipated. Meanwhile, counties east
of the Highway 65 corridor will remain in a Winter Weather
Advisory until Noon on Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of up
to one inch.

* WHERE...Benton, Hickory and Polk Counties.

* WHEN...Until noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of wintry weather will be possible
during the Thursday morning commute. Travel impacts will be
minor, but there may be a few icy patches.
properties.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY
